index="covid" host="covid-19" | dedup source | fields source
`comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval time=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10)
| sort time | stats last(time) AS last_time
| table last_time
| makeresults | eval title="STATE CHARTS" | fields title

latest=-$tally_time$ index="covid" host="covid-19" ($state1$) source!="*\\01-*" `comment("remove january numbers")`
| rename Province_State AS State | eval County=coalesce(Admin2,"") `comment("fix null Admin2 fields and rename as County")`
`comment("get CSV name which is the date")` | eval day=substr(source, len(source)-13, 10) | eval last_update=_indextime `comment("This is important for the timechart to present only the most updated results -- in case old results have been updated")`
| dedup day,State,County sortby -last_update `comment("keep only the most recently indexed results. in other words, if more than one value exists for given day due to adjusting of historical data, only show the freshest, most recently updated value.")` | eval day_epoch=strptime(day,"%m-%d-%Y") | eval _time=day_epoch | stats sum(Confirmed) AS Confirmed BY State,_time | streamstats current=f window=1 last(Confirmed) as prev_Confirmed by State | eval delta=Confirmed-coalesce(prev_Confirmed,0) | timechart span=1$tally_time$ sum(delta) AS "New Cases" by State
